Tasks / Threads
[Real-Time Operation System]

Detailed Description

This modules provides functions for creating and manipulating tasks/threads.


Functions

HRESULT TCTaskCreate (uint32 *taskID, const char *taskName, void(*taskEntry)(void *), uint32 priority, uint32 stackSize)

Function Documentation

HRESULT TCTaskCreate (  uint32 *  taskID,
const char *  taskName,
void(*)(void *)  taskEntry,
uint32  priority,
uint32  stackSize
) 
 

Create a task.

Parameters:
taskID The address to place the taskID.
taskName The name for the task.
taskEntry The entry point for the task.
priority The priority for the task. See TCTaskingDefs.h
stackSize The stack size to use. See TASK_STACKSIZE_DEFAULT in TCTaskingDefs.h
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCTaskCreateEx (  uint32 *  taskID,
const char *  taskName,
void(*)(void *)  taskEntry,
void *  taskData,
uint32  priority,
uint32  stackSize
) 
 

Create a task, extended version.

Parameters:
taskID The address to place the taskID.
taskName The name for the task.
taskEntry The entry point for the task.
taskData void * to be passed into the entry point.... usually an obj pointer.
priority The priority for the task. See TCTaskingDefs.h
stackSize The stack size to use. See TASK_STACKSIZE_DEFAULT in TCTaskingDefs.h
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCTaskResume (  uint32  taskID  ) 
 

Resume a suspended task.

Parameters:
taskID The ID of the task to resume.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCTaskSuspend (  uint32  taskID  ) 
 

Suspend a task.

Parameters:
taskID The ID of the task to resume.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

uint32 TCTaskGetMyID (  void   ) 
 

Enables a task to obtain its task ID.

Returns:
The ID of the calling task.

void TCTaskYield (  void   ) 
 

Yield to other tasks.

void TCTaskWait (  uint32  msecs  ) 
 

Wait for the specified number of millisecondss.

Parameters:
msecs The time to wait in milliseconds.

BOOL TCTaskStarted (  void   ) 
 

Are all task started?

Returns:
false (0) for not started or true (1) for started.
